page.title: 01EAST-CENTRAL SHEFFIELD
page.content: Attercliffe and Darnall are east of {Sheffield}city centre in the Don Valley, once the hub of a large steel making{industry.}The decline of steel production in recent years has lead to problems of redundancy and dereliction. Years ago the area would have been full of smoke and grime belching from the works, but now the air is clean. Smaller industries have survived and new small, eficient firms are moving into the area. A large percentage of the population are Asian{imigrants}who have moved into those terraced houses which have survived the slum clearance programme. A number of{gypsy families}live in the area- dealing in scrap metal- some on an official site but others in the waste-lands created by the bulldozers.
